It's not likely that I'll lose my life.
He then gathered his friends and relatives to testify.

source_sentence: 拜謝其婦(已上二事釋成泰說)。
translation: He paid his respects to the woman and thanked her (after the above two explanations by Chengtai).
There was a cotton merchant who went to the village to collect flowers.
There was a cotton merchant who went to his hometown to collect flowers.
On his way, he met a dog fighter who was carrying a large dog.
He bought it, released it, and fed it with leftover food.
He fed it with leftover food.
He never left his side.
One day, he went to Dingjiazhou to collect flowers.
The traveling master asked him to send his boat.
The dog also went with him.
The boatman saw how much money the customer had.
He got up without conscience.

source_sentence: 撐至江邊將客置布袋中。
translation: He carried him to the river and put the customer in a cloth bag.
He tied the mouth of the bag and threw it into the water.

source_sentence: 犬遂下水口銜袋結嘶吠不已。
translation: The dog then went down into the water and held the bag in its mouth, barking noisily.
When the fisherman saw it, he pulled it out.
The customer was then able to recover.
He went back to the river and walked in.
He explained the incident in detail.
The proprietor of the business consoled the guest's mind.
He pretended he didn't know.
He went to the boatman's house to inquire about it.

source_sentence: 客信且邀舟子到行飲酒。
translation: The guest believed him and invited the boatman to the business for a drink.
He then asked the guest to come out and interrogate him.
He confessed his guilt and returned the original silver.
There's a man who lives in a mansion on Mount Jiuhuashan.
He liked to kill deer.
One day, he led a group of people to net a deer.
He saw an old deer with a different color of body.
He searched around for it.
When the deer saw his strength, he was forced to flee into the ranch.
The crowd rushed back in.
The deer fell to its knees and begged for its life in tears.
The herdsmen stabbed the deer in the eye with a spear.
The deer hadn't yet been skinned.
The man of the village was suddenly blinded first.
There was a family member named Wu Mao of the sixth estate of Laotian in Qingyang County.
There was a family member named Wu Mao.
He was very clean and observed precepts and kept a vegetarian diet.
When the leftist army crossed the river to seize and kill people, the owners all ran away and avoided them.
The owners all ran away and avoided them.
Wu Mao was the only one who guarded the house for the master.
He was shot seven times and died.
In a moment, his younger brother came to see him.
Mao woke up again.
He said to his brother.
"My past actions should have resulted in seven acceptances of the pig's body.
It was because of the power of the precepts that I received seven strokes.
Now, I've received seven sticks to pay for past causes.
I'll now be reborn in heaven.
After he finished speaking, he passed away.
His younger brother had never believed in goodness.
He was shocked to hear about it.
He too then returned to his heart.
The streams on Jiuhuashan often produce stone fowls.
Their shape resembles a toad, but they're large.
They taste better than domestic fowls.
Whenever a superior crosses the county, he'll take a ticket for it.
He'll always take it with a ticket.
Occasionally, it's one night.
A man from the village lit a fire on the cliff.
He stretched out his hand to retrieve it.
A stone fowl bit him on both hands.
He died without being able to retrieve them.
He waited until the fifth watch of the night.
He heard the temple bell ring.

source_sentence: 石雞各似合掌念佛之狀。
translation: The stone fowls each looked like they were reciting Buddha with their palms together.
The villagers were then able to escape.
There was a man in Chizhou province.

That man dreamt that the three officials told him.
"In a previous life, you killed a man.
Now, you're here to take revenge.
You can't avoid it.
He woke up in fear.
He again prayed.
Again, he had a dream saying.
'Past actions are hard to escape.

But your longtime enemy's name is Zhu Qi.
He's riding a red horse.
Tomorrow, he'll surely come.
You may kneel at the door.
Say with your mouth, "General Zhu Qi, please let me live!

source_sentence: 彼或問汝何故知我名字。
translation: Perhaps he asks how you know my name.
You can tell him in two dreams.

source_sentence: 次日果於門前見有騎紅馬者。
translation: The next day, he did see a man on a red horse at the gate.

"He visited a friend.

source_sentence: 夜夢黃冠羽流三人奔求救命。
translation: In a nightmare, he dreamt that three men with yellow crowns and feathers ran to seek his life.
They were denigrated by someone in the same garb.
The next day, they were walking along the road.
He saw a boy carrying three eels in his hand.
They were unusually large and fat.
He bought them and put them in a well.
A nearby monk slandered him and scolded him.
He said it wasn't fit to put them in the well.

source_sentence: 方悟夜夢即此三鱔云(已上六事俱釋隆仁說)。
translation: He then realized that his nighttime dream was about these three eels (all six of the above mentioned things were explained by Shi Longren).
Cheng Boqi, a merchant from Huizhou, was a long-time resident of Yangzhou.
He had lived in Yangzhou for a long time.
He was very religious in serving Avalokitêśvara the Great Master.
In the summer of Beyo, the northern army attacked Yangzhou.
Cheng prayed to the bodhisattva for help.
He then had a dream, saying.
'There are 17 people in your family.
The other 16 members of your family aren't in the kalpa.
You're the only one who counts.
You can't escape.
Cheng had awakened.
He prayed again.
He still had the dream, saying.

source_sentence: 汝前生殺王麻子二十六刀。
translation: 'In a previous life, you killed Wang Mazi with 26 stabs.
Now, you must repay him.
You mustn't escape.
You must divide your household among 16 members.
They'll all stay in the east wing.
You'll wait for them alone in the mezzanine.
Don't leave your family behind.
Cheng Li chewed his heart out.
After five days, the northern army barricaded their entrance.

"Aren't you Wang Muzi?

source_sentence: 若是王麻子可來殺我二十六刀。
translation: If you are Wang Mazi, you can come and kill me with twenty-six swords.
If you are not Wang Mazi, then there is no enmity.
There's no need to go through the gate.
The soldier said.

The soldier dismounted from his horse and asked in surprise.
"How do you know my name?
Cheng told him exactly what he had told him in two dreams.
The soldier praised him and said.
'In a past life, you killed me with 26 swords.

Now, I've killed you.

source_sentence: 汝於來世不將又報我乎。
translation: Won't you repay me again in the next life?'" he said.

source_sentence: 乃以刀背斫程二十六下而宥之。
translation: He then struck Cheng twenty-six times with the back of his sword and excused him.
He took his family with him to Jinling.
